Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 13:29 - Hi David here again. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue works on the overhead network in the LU7 3 area, we've now restored power to most of the affected properties. There are now only 3 properties without power, who we'll speak to directly. If you're without power and haven't been contacted, then we'll need to hear from you. Please call us on 08003163105 (free from landlines and mobiles).

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the unexpected outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 13:11 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 19 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 26 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:53 - Thanks for your patience this afternoon.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 21:13 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Seaview Avenue area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We know the time frame we estimated is now approaching. Our engineers are continuing their work to repair our underground network in the Seaview Avenue area.

As our staff are working with live electricity, we need to wait until it is safe for them to stop and contact us with an update.

We're sorry you've been impacted by this, and we'll provide you an update as soon as possible. Sent by Simon at 20:18.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible. A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer. We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 09:29 - Hi David here again. We have now restored power to the St Clements Close area.

We are truly sorry for the power cuts recently. We believe there may be an underlying issue causing this, but it is proving difficult for our engineers to locate and therefore fix. To get your power back on today we have reconfigured the local electricity network. This in turn will both help pinpoint the issue and minimise further interruptions.

If you'd like more information on the issue, or if your power isn't back on, call us on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Lisa at 03:00 - We can now confirm that all power in the Ivy Chimneys area should be back on. The recent issues were being caused by an unexpected underground fault, which our engineers have repaired.

We know this has interrupted your power several times, and we're sorry the power cut today lasted longer than the others. We don't expect this issue to affect your power again, but we'll monitor the situation closely. Rest assured our staff will work around the clock to get your lights back on.

If your power isn't on, or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105, free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Lisa at 02:00 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers.

We know your power may now be back on; however, we'll keep sending text updates until everyone's electricity is restored. To stop SMS updates, visit our website here - https://bit.ly/348KOZ3.

If your power is still affected, our engineers have been in touch to advise that excavations are taking longer than expected. Due to this, we're now estimating that we'll have the remaining power restored by 02:30 and 03:30.

We're very sorry to adjust our time frame, but we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress.

Sent by Lisa at 01:40 -

We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu
 
If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 06:50 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to 18 additional customers in the Milton Keynes MK17 9 area to safely repair damage to the network, caused by a road traffic collision.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Following on from our previous message, we can now confirm we have switched power off to 18 properties. This is to allow our engineers to safely repair our network. If your electricity is affected by this, you can get live updates on the incident through our website here - http://www.ukpowernetworks.co.uk/power-cut/incident?incidentid=[INCIDENTID].
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 02:26 - Thanks for your patience today. Our engineers have now investigated the overhead cable on the ground, and have deemed it safe to restore power back to all 665 properties in the Milton Keynes MK17 9 & Dunstable LU5 6 area.

We're very sorry we had to turn your power off unexpectedly, and with so little warning. We usually provide much more notice if we can, but in a situation like this our first priority is the safety of the public and our staff.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. If your power is still off or if you have any questions, call our team on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 07:43 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 291 customers in the Chesham HP5 1/HP5 3  area, by diverting power around the overhead network fault. We understand how difficult a power cut can be, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 06:06 - Thanks for your patience this morning.

Our staff are checking our equipment throughout the area to pinpoint the issue on our overhead cabling network. In addition to this, they are liaising closely with our control room to find safe and reliable ways to divert power around any problems and get everyone restored.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Engineers have arrived on site in the Chesham HP5 1  area to investigate an overhead network fault currently affecting 291 properties. Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

Using an average timescale for this type of issue we're looking to have you back on between 08:30 and 09:30, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We'll continue to update you with all of our progress.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 12:16 - We can now confirm that all power in the Broadway area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Broadway area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Sent by Aaron at 11:45.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 11:35 - Our staff are on the way to the Broadway area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 15:00 and 16:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We've had to turn off power in your area so our engineers can safely carry out emergency repairs to the network.

Logs.Comment:
Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut today, our staff will work to restore your power as quickly and as safely as possible.

A lot of our customers have questions regarding power cuts, and though you can always reach our team, you can also find some helpful information and answers to some of our most frequently asked questions on our website here - https://bit.ly/3pTfAz9 - Bear in mind this will use your mobile data, so feel free to speak to us if you'd prefer.

We'll be in touch again once we have more information from our staff.

Sent by Bev at 14:09 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity.

Our engineers have turned off the power in the Norwich NR12 9 area for safety so they can complete network repairs. Our estimated time to have your power back on is between 16:30 and 17:30, however, this may need to change later depending on how our works progress.

If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://bit.ly/3cYez0V. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 14:36 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 15:49 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 184 properties still affected by the isolation, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 206 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Bury St. Edmunds area and are investigating the fault. You may find your power is going on and off; that is normal for this type of issue and is due to our engineers working to divert power remotely. By doing this, we've managed to restore power to 1 customers. There are now 390 properties still affected. We'll keep sending SMS updates until everybody is restored. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Sent by Bev at 14:47.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 14:30 - Our engineers are on their way to investigate reports of a grounded overhead cable, affecting 391 properties.

Specialist engineers from our control room are also working to divert power remotely, so it's possible your power could come back on at any point. We can't always restore everyone this way. That's why we're also sending staff to the area to check our equipment.

Every fault is different, so our time frames have to be estimated but currently we hope to have power back on between 15:30 and 16:30. We must stress that it may become necessary for this to change, depending on what our engineers find.

We'll keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 14:43. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
